												How come no one told me this game existed?Alien Shooter 2: Reloaded is a masterfully crafted horde-style action game with RPG elements (what a mouthful) that's all about running backwards and shooting. Shooting what, you totally didn't ask because it's in the title? Eeeeeveeeerythiiiiiiiing.Horde games usually struggle with enemy balance and keeping those enemies interesting. And RPG games usually struggle with balancing an effort-to-reward ratio that makes players feel accomplished and powerful without stressing them out too much or taking too much time.But Running Backwards and Shooting: The Game nails everything.The enemy design is stellar. Enemies are slow-moving, come in droves, can attack the player from multiple directions, and are NEVER bullet sponges! The more powerful enemies are even slower, and many of them have ranged attacks that are telegraphed nicely. The game follows (and never breaks) the golden rule of enemy design: The faster the enemy, the weaker it is; the stronger the enemy, the slower it is.The enemies are varied enough that the player must learn to prioritize and adapt on the fly. There are times when caution is the better part of valor, and other times when the player must be aggressive or they risk being overrun.The progression system is also just right. Money is limited, and that can make the game stressful at first. The player is never sure if they should buy that shotgun, or that implant, or upgrade their armor, or save it all for that one powerful rocket launcher. But that's what makes it satisfying. Players must plan ahead and be smart about their choices, not just with their money, but also with their stats.In a perfectly reasonable amount of time, the player is rewarded for their smart build choices and purchases, and a true sense of progression and accomplishment sets in. That's usually right around the time the player discovers that they have enough money to pay for that new assault rifle AND that RPG they've been eyeing, and then they enter the next mission and give the entire map a bloody makeover.But make no mistake: The game is always ready to throw new enemies -- and tougher combinations of old enemies -- at the player. This game is challenging! But it's never too challenging, and that sort of game balance should be applauded.Stylistically, the game is cheesy (in a charming sort of way) with a dark atmosphere. Surprisingly, these two things, combined with the overall challenge of the game, come together to create something that's easy to take seriously, but that doesn't take itself seriously, making for a truly fun game that never feels like it's being self-gratifying.THANK YOU, Sigma Team, for showing us all how it's done!

												Alien Shooter 2: Reloaded is the follow up to Alien Shooter. Much like its predecessor, you spend the game shooting lots and lots of aliens. It improves on the original in many ways, and in the process becomes a game that can become worthy of some of your time.The graphics have seen a marked improvement in AS2. You earn experience through your actions, and can level up in about 6 categories. I am not quite sure how a high intelligence would help you in this game, but it is one of the categories. You also spend your cash on weapon upgrades to help your hunting a little easier.Alien Shooter 2 has voice acting that is serviceable, and the music adds a nice touch much like the original.Alien Shooter 2: Reloaded can be recommended for the improvements that were made over its predecessor. All of the major flaws were addressed, with better controls, graphics and enemy variety. If you are looking for a mindless shooter than this game is worthy of a try.Grade: C+

												What can i say about alien shooter? Its amazing.Zombie shooter is an overhead action/shooter/rpg?? game that delivers nicely.An alien treath has arrived to earth and is decimating the population. Your mission is to find how did they arrived and to destroy them. Could say more, but thats about right for the story (and i wouldnt like to give spoilers).Anyways, a description of some aspects of the game.Variety of enemies. Unlike many "Horde" games, this one has quite a decent number of enemies. The combination of the different classes of the enemies in the screen makes the game actually decently hard. Not to mention, i have never seen a game with so many enemies at the same time.Good amount of weapons, most do well, some are specialized in certain situations only, but there are few that are all round up. Still, plenty to satisfy your gamestyle.At the beginning of the game, you have a "special trait" that you can choose,  which ranges from being able to recover some health x second to have some extra perception (for being able to find secrets), among others. Although you can clear the game with any, changing from one to another may affect how you progress in the game drastically according to your style of gameplay. Choose wisely.You can use some vehicles. Not many, but its fun to squash aliens with a tank, not to mention that they would kill you in matter of secons if you are not inside.Secret areas. To aditionally keep you busy, the game has many secret areas, most are just an extra room with some money/weapons, but you do feel rewarded, since its a decent extra loot for finding it. i found a lot, but way too far from finding every single one for every single level.Playing time: I finished this game a long time ago, i dont remember how many missions does it has (around 30), but the time to complete the game is around 7-8 hours since most missions are short, however, if you are looking every secret, killing most monsters, etc, ill be a lil bit longer. Also, the end missions are harder, and i mean it, sometimes takes longer to complete those ones (since you have only 3 lives) if going carefully.Replay value: This game is very fun, but the amount of enemies is overwhelming, that i can become tedious at times (so basically, at the end of the game you should have slayed a couple of MILLIONS of enemies) so yeah, virtually the grey floor is red at the end of the mission. Each time you play it, you can go for different characters/stats/passive trait, but at the end, you will do about the same build, the replay value relays on killing the alien horde over and over and over again. (This is my first run with this game @Steam, but i have finished it lile 10 times or so)Graphics. The game is not new, it has some 5~7 years under the belt, and still look nice. but seriously graphics is not really an issue,  my graphics card (ati radeon 3870 at the time.) was having some trouble at the final stage due to the amount of enemies at the same time. medium graphics are OK for this game.Sound. Not a masterpiece for sure, but it does the job, sets the mood in the game, you forget about it.Bad thingsIt has a co-op survival and probably a versus mode i think, Shame that no one is online ever, it might be fun to have a partner. Survival is fun but alone feels like meh. Its quite challenging though.Dumb AI. Although they will always try to get you, some will stuck in corners or any object that is in  between, some will stuck with other aliens. However, not a great deal, since there are many enemies, being stuck they will not overwhelm you from all sides every single time, you can create some bottlenecks. Not my intention to write a wall of text, but just to give you a general idea for your money. (probably worth 15~ bucks )

												The first time I hear about the original Alien Shooter, I was not even in Junior High. Back then, it could ran on Windows 2000 (just to show how far back the game goes!) and I tried the trial version, downloading it from the school's computer since a friend was playing it as well. 2 levels was all it took for me to scour the electronic center, looking for the bootleg version. (Hey, I barely have any cash back then! >_<)Somehow, a guy from school found one, and that game was installed in every computer in the IT class. Of course, as time goes on and my preference changes, I start to play other games, forgetting that after 4 years, SIGMA made a sequel out of it. I on the other hand was busy with highschool, so I didn't pay much attention to games at that time. A year back, I received the game from a friend, and while I have installed it, I never have the intention to play it. I didn't think that finally, after all these years, it gave me the nostalgia feeling all over again. :)So, the game itself, is pretty much similar to the original 2003 version with some additions to the characters and perks. Weapon wise, they have added new choices and classes, from the generic weapons like Colt .45; Rocket Propelled Grenade (RPG); AK47 to prototype guns e.g. M̶o̶r̶e̶ ̶e̶x̶p̶e̶n̶s̶i̶v̶e̶ ̶t̶h̶a̶n̶ ̶T̶r̶u̶m̶p̶'̶s̶ ̶W̶a̶l̶l̶ ̶b̶u̶t̶ ̶j̶u̶s̶t̶ ̶p̶o̶i̶n̶t̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶f̶o̶r̶g̶e̶t̶ ̶w̶h̶i̶l̶e̶ ̶i̶t̶ ̶t̶u̶r̶n̶s̶ ̶e̶v̶e̶r̶y̶t̶h̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶i̶n̶t̶o̶ ̶g̶i̶b̶l̶e̶t̶s̶ G5000 Ion Cannon. The aliens are also have more variety, a step up from the original, from generic spidery aliens and some notable ones from the original to mecha-Transformer suit wearing aliens with ion cannons. There are also traps abound, from thorn-like plants to green-containers that spew green goo which acts like acid and cause damage if you step on it. However, the main thing that hooks people in (including me back then) is the action. Non-stop action, gun-blazing with almost endless aliens in the screen running towards you with 1 goal in sight. I can say that this was part of the positive traits that why I loved the original, and somewhat enjoyed this sequel. At one point in a level late in the game, there were so much alien teleporters, spawning aliens with rocket launchers, spitting acid, and firing ions shooting at me that I just blindly use my trusty M̶o̶r̶e̶ ̶e̶x̶p̶e̶n̶s̶i̶v̶e̶ ̶t̶h̶a̶n̶ ̶T̶r̶u̶m̶p̶'̶s̶ ̶W̶a̶l̶l̶ ̶b̶u̶t̶ ̶j̶u̶s̶t̶ ̶p̶o̶i̶n̶t̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶f̶o̶r̶g̶e̶t̶ ̶w̶h̶i̶l̶e̶ ̶i̶t̶ ̶t̶u̶r̶n̶s̶ ̶e̶v̶e̶r̶y̶t̶h̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶i̶n̶t̶o̶ ̶g̶i̶b̶l̶e̶t̶s̶ G5000 Ion Cannon. After ten minutes (which seems like an eternity), the battleground is quiet, and I faced the last boss. Of course, going down at 1/2 health is just a gimmick. Surprise! More aliens! D:After a few more minutes, teleporters destroyed, 80,000+ aliens harmed-most of them turned into giblets-and the final boss falls! Oh, oh, almost forgot, before the last level, there is a juncture where you have to make a decision, which will lead to different outcome, and a great addition. :D Nonetheless, one thing that they haven't fully fixed from the original is the alien pathing, as they will get stuck by trees and corners allowing players to reduce the numbers slightly using explosive weapons, for example. Still, while this game is 10 years old (gasp!) and can still run on Windows 2000 (!) it provides lots of action and entertainment for anyone who enjoys playing top-down shooting games. It also have other features like survival mode for those who liked more challenges.P.s. I wonder, how long would the Viscera Cleanup team take to clean the last level in this game? :P

												Aliens Shooter 2: Reloaded is a game that throws hordes and hordes of enemies at the player until every inch of the level is covered in their blood and entrails. The developer clearly wanted to make a game that has constant action and they achieved that. This game barely has a moment without combat, which I like as sometimes it is nice to play a game that is just crazy gameplay. The player will constantly be backpedaling as they shoot the endless waves of aliens, somewhat like Smash TV. When the player kills a significant number of enemies, they level up and are given 5 skill points per level to improve the character's stats. For example, the player can upgrade their 'accuracy' stat which dictates how much damage the player will do. The player can also improve their health, strength, speed, intelligence and a 'special' skill such as health regeneration. The player can also manage an inventory and buy items from a shop located in every level. The aforementioned features are the RPG elements of this game - very light RPG elements I might add. If you're looking for a game with deep stat customization or indepth weapon info, you'll be disappointed with this game. I think the RPG elements in this game are perfect for an arcade shooter such as this one. The story is simple: evil corporation delves into the unknown and brings forth human killing aliens. Your job is to investigate what happened and eradicate all alien life, discreetly of course. Weyland Yu- excuse me, M.A.G.M.A. corp will be the majority of the locations you visit. Labs, armories and sewers. The voice acting is pretty bad and gives off a 'cheap' vibe but I believe it is forgivable considering the main point of the game is to blast aliens to smithereens and the developers are a very small team of Russians. The music is good! They advertise it as dynamic but this basically means that the game will begin playing 'action' music during battles and atmospheric music during non-combat sections. The action music is catchy and nice to blast aliens to, while the atmospheric music is even better and as it is actually creepy and gives off a horror vibe. The player will hear distant roars, buzzing and generally the noises of dread. Love it. Graphics are not bad but obviously not good either. What annoyed me is the fact that the game doesn't include a 1920 x 1080 resolution, which is strange considering it was developed in 2007. So expect aliased graphics. Besides that, the enviroments do look good. The labs are realistic but appear fictional at the same time, the alien design is reminiscent of aliens from other works of fiction but overall I liked it. The gore is fantastic and it will never get old blowing a hole in an alien's stomach. The game isn't very long, only about 5 hours on normal difficulty but the player can lengthen this by playing on a harder difficulty. There is two submodes called Stand Firm and Gun Stand but only Gun Stand is worth playing. Basically you defend a spot against alien waves and upgrade your turret. I recommend this game if you enjoy games like Smash TV or arcade shooters.6/10

												8/10The first Alien Shooter was already quite a good game. This sequel was even better.It maintains the base gameplay of the original game - move around, aim with the mouse, shoot aliens. However, it also includes more things that make the game much more interesting. Attributes weigh quite heavily on gameplay, hence leveling up really does make a difference. The perks are quite interesting and varied.The best of all is actually the variety of weapons. Even among weapons of the same type (shotguns, automatic weapons, etc), there's often a large difference as they vary heavily on damage, reload times, fire rate and accuracy. The game actually makes the player want to purchase new weapons and test them out against enemies - and some weapons are just crazy fun to use (the miniguns are a personal favorite of mine).Bigger variety of enemies and the addition of vehicles are also considerable improvements.Camera is still an issue. Just like its predecessor, camera angle is fixed and there's no transparency effect, meaning there are items and enemies that may be behind walls and the player won't be able to see these.

												I wasn't sure what I could expect from Alien Shooter 2: Reloaded. I mean, I spend really many hours playing the first Alien Shooter game - more than 10 years ago when it was added in certain gaming magazine in my country and not so long ago when I get my copy on Steam. So, here I am, after finishing this game. It looks same. It's same gameplay. You could say, the time stopped for this one, even if it was released around 6 years after first game... BUT, there is something that, even tho it's feels old and nostalgic, gives something refreshing. New aliens, new variety of weapons, new level up system, new vehicles, new shooting mode. Yes, a good old game that was improved on so many levels. You can complain about story, about voices or dunno what more BUT that doesn't change one fact - it's still solid and great fun game when it comes to gameplay.If you ever loved first Alien Shooter game, you must play it. Not sure if new players would be pleased with this kind of games in times when, sadly, games are focusing on everything but not on pure fun of playing. I know I will replay it at once when I will feel hunger for some intense action and simply fun of killing tons of aliens.
